hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Auto-generate baseline benchmarks from historical CRM data during setup.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds an onboarding/setup step that automatically derives baseline sales benchmarks from a customer’s own CRM opportunity history (last 6–12 months). Instead of asking admins to manually define assumptions in spreadsheets, the product will propose defaults such as average time in stage, stage-to-stage conversion rates, win rate, and typical deal size (including segmentation where the CRM data supports it). The intent is to make “day one” configuration faster while ensuring benchmarks reflect actual historical performance.

The primary user impact is on revenue operations and sales operations admins responsible for initial setup and ongoing calibration. They’ll see recommended benchmark values alongside clear data coverage indicators—time window analyzed and sample size—so they can quickly judge reliability, accept as-is, or edit specific numbers. This reduces setup friction, improves confidence in the model, and creates a repeatable starting point across teams and accounts.

Downstream, the chosen benchmarks become a durable configuration layer used to calibrate forecasting and power “deal at risk” alerts. Because benchmarks are grounded in observed CRM behavior, forecasts should start closer to reality and risk flags should be better aligned with what “normal” progression looks like for that org (and segment, when available). This also creates a consistent baseline for measuring improvement over time.

Key considerations include handling sparse or skewed datasets (e.g., low opportunity volume, seasonality, major process changes) and making those limitations explicit via coverage indicators. The UI should clearly distinguish system-recommended values from admin edits, and persistence should be reliable so subsequent forecasting and alerts are stable. Overall, this feature shifts setup from manual configuration to guided, data-driven defaults while preserving admin control.
